heroDescription: Discover top-rated local advisors in Houston, Texas, dedicated to helping you achieve your financial goals. These professionals are well-versed in navigating the unique financial landscape of this bustling city.
landscapeDescription: With one of the country's fastest-growing economies, Houston is a hub for a diverse range of industries. Major employers include Exxon Mobil, Memorial Hermann Health System, and the University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center. The financial advisory landscape is equally diverse, with many professionals specializing in oil and gas investments, healthcare, and real estate.
majorIndustries: Oil and Gas Exploration, Healthcare, Aerospace and Aviation, and Manufacturing
uniqueNeeds: Given Houston's prominence in the oil and gas industry, many residents may require specialized financial planning related to energy investments. Likewise, with a significant healthcare sector, planning for medical expenses is a common need. The city's rapid growth also presents unique opportunities for real estate investment.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: Houston's economy grew by 2.1% in 2019, outpacing the national growth rate of 1.9%. The city's GDP is $490 billion, making it the 6th largest in the US.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: The median household income in Houston is $63,802. According to US Census data, 6.9% of Houston households earn over $200,000 annually. Houston is also home to 21 billionaires, according to Forbes.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Financial advisors in Houston commonly specialize in energy sector investments, given the city's strong ties to the oil and gas industry. Other popular specializations include retirement planning and wealth management for high-net-worth individuals.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: The cost of living in Houston is 2.9% lower than the national average, with housing being the biggest factor in the cost of living difference. The average rent for a one-bedroom apartment is $1,100 per month.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: The median home value in Houston is $191,907. Home values have gone up 5.2% over the past year and Zillow predicts they will fall -1.5% within the next year.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: Houston is home to 21 Fortune 500 companies, the fourth most of any city in the U.S. Major industries include oil and gas, aerospace, healthcare, and technology. The city also has a growing startup scene, with over 3,000 tech startups in the region.
